titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 276: Dhakhīrat al-Iskandar al-Malik ibn Fīliqs Dhī al-Qarnayn.

note: Title from title page and introduction (f. 4r)

msContents.summary: Copy of a treatise on talismans and astrology said to be by Aristotle who wrote it for Alexander the Great, then said to have been translated into Arabic at the request of the Caliph al-Muʻtaṣim. 23 ink illustrations of various creatures drawn on slightly darker paper pasted onto the substrate.

title: Dhakhīrat al-Iskandar al-Malik ibn Fīliqs Dhī al-Qarnayn.

title.#text: ذخيرة الاسكندر الملك بن فيلقس ذي القرنين

supportDesc.extent: 59 leaves : 260 x 175 (190 x 110) mm, bound to 270 x 180 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in Hindu-Arabic numerals in pencil, upper center recto. Catchwords every verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: 13 lines per page with some lines shortened when necessary to fit an image.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in clear naskh in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Rubrications in red. 23 small monochrome illustrations on brown paper pasted onto the substrate (f. 34v-37r, 38v-39v, 40v-41v, 42v, 44v-46r).

binding.p: Half covers. Brown textile spine and corners with brown and green marble paper sides over pasteboard. Plain brown doublure.

origin.p: The item is undated, but perhaps copied in the 18th or first half of the 19th century.

provenance: Formerly owned by George A. Plimpton (bookplate inside front cover).
